results.title: Harlem Wednesday
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Edward Harrison and Story Board
results.brief_description: Using the paintings of the American artist Gregario Prestopino, the camera explores life in Harlem throughout the day and late into the night. With jazz accompaniment and clever editing, the film epitomises the life of the people and the atmosphere of their environment. Harlem Wednesday won an award at the Venice Film Festival.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Edward Harrison and Story Board

results.title: Harlem diary: nine voices of resilience [NTSC]
results.creator_credit: Jonathan Stack, Spencer Style, Mary Beth Mann, Terry Williams, Discovery Channel and Gabriel Films
results.brief_description: Poignant and confronting, this documentary portrayal of life in the streets of Harlem (notorious for its gang violence, drugs and shootings) is presented through the personal stories of nine young African Americans drawn from a broad cross-section of the African American community in Harlem whose ages range from 12 through to 26 years old. Writer and sociologist Terry Williams befriended the group, provided them with notebooks and video cameras and sent them out to make an autobiography of the city of Harlem and its community through their eyes and in their words. Each person views their life and Harlem from a different perspective providing the positive as well as the negative such as 18 year-old Jermaine (architect student) who is concerned about the thousands of abandoned buildings, turning his anger and frustration into determination and positive action; 12 year-old Amir (actor), star of theatre, commercials and TV soapies, brought up in a privileged environment but still managing to keep his feet on the ground; 17 year-old Barr Elliot “Star Dragon” (hip-hop singer) who directed his “kill or be killed” mentality into music and the dream of being successful one day; and 18 year-old Nikki Matos (teenage mother) who, surrounded by the ethos of violence and killing among young black males, is determined to create a better life for her young son. Most of the group come from single parent families, some from violent backgrounds, but their resilience and determination to overcome their circumstances is truly inspiring. Gritty and at times disturbing, revealing the dark world of drugs, poverty and violence, “Harlem diary” also engenders a sense of dignity, humour, passion and hope by these nine thoughtful young people.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jonathan Stack, Spencer Style, Mary Beth Mann, Terry Williams, Discovery Channel and Gabriel Films

results.title: Hardy Heating Co.Ltd.: the accountant - the information manager
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Introduction by Graham Turner. Looks at the role of the accountant in a relatively small company where he has to be both financial and management accountant. The aim of the program is to show the role and the managerial position of an accountant

results.title: Hardwoods of Papua New Guinea
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Don Murray and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The film surveys timber developments showing logging, milling, paper-pulp making, and chip mills. Also shown is the work of the Forest Products Research Centre which provides technological assistance and re-afforestation [sic] programs.

results.title: Hardware wars
results.brief_description: A hilarious parody of the space epic “Star Wars” [306301 / 300668 (captioned)]in which special effects are made with household appliances,available in any hardware store. The film takes on high budget spectaculars and “Coming Attraction” trailers, with particular emphasis on the special effects syndrome.

results.title: Harder than Everest
results.brief_description: Of the ten Himalayan expeditions I’ve been on, climbing Mt Gasherbraum IV was the most challenging and spectacular - it was harder than Everest. These are the words of Tim Macartney-Snape, one of a group of seven climbers who actually made it to the summit and shot the entire experience on film at the same time. A spectacular and inspiring video about human achievement.

results.title: Hardening and tempering carbon steel
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Metalwork”.
Explains the reasons for and the processes involved in the hardening and tempering of three typical tools manufactured from hard carbon steel: a scraper, a cold chisel, and a screwdriver.

results.title: Hard water
results.creator_credit: Peter Griffiths, Michael Clarke, Unilever Films and View Point
results.brief_description: Rain falling to earth as a weak acid reaches the tap as a solution of ionic compounds. Soap reacts with these compounds to form insoluble calcium soap, precipitated as scum, while soapless detergents form soluble acid salts. Gives an explanation of water softening by ion exchange.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Griffiths, Michael Clarke, Unilever Films and View Point

results.title: Hard to windward
results.creator_credit: Max Graham, Norman Laird and Tasmanian Government Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Sydney-Hobart Yacht Race, Starting every year on Boxing Day. Shows the start in Sydney Harbour, following one boat through the race to the finish on the River Derwent, and celebrations and prize giving which follow.
